alert.note: Alert for Koochiching; North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:54AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL ITASCA AND SOUTHEASTERN KOOCHICHING COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 154 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of Togo, to 8 miles east of Effie, to 6 miles east of Bigfork, to near Marcell, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Itasca and southeastern Koochiching Counties, including the following locations... North Star Lake, Spider Lake, Gunn Lake, Bois Forte Band Deer Creek Area, Coon Lake, Scenic State Park, Bois Forte Band Nett Lake Area and Deer Lake Northern Itasca County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
